Literature Review: The discovery of chemical reactions is a fundamental problem in chemistry, and predicting the whole process of a chemical reaction while solving kinetic equations has been a long-standing challenge. In recent years, various methods have been developed to tackle this problem, including the artificial force induced reaction method (AFIRM) and the rate constant matrix contraction method (RCMCM). These methods have shown great promise in discovering new chemical reactions and optimizing existing ones. In this review, we will discuss the current state of the art in ab initio reaction discovery using AFIRM and RCMCM, and explore the challenges and prospects of this field.
